channel.title: Thoughts and comments?
channel.description:
I found a template that I liked and change the colors and little things about it and wanted some feedback.
It's for my boss's business so keep that in mind. Negative/positive feedback is appreciated. From the humans eye I really haven't done a lot and I've ran out of ideas on how to make it look better or how to make it more interactive so anything you have to say on that topic would be appreciated as well. Thanks.
http://www.hastingsunlimited.net/
[code] Update 3/15 10:06 CENTRAL:
Decided to try and piece things together again so I am starting over but with the same design. [/code]

item.title: Thoughts and comments?
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:16, topic:507711”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=625947.msg4260071#msg4260071 date=1363384714]
Or at least center the white text in the tops of them
[/quote]
Bad idea:

yhiNvuA.png1774×716

Why is each line of the headers in a separate

tag? I’d love to see a text reader read them semantics. If you want them to be a separate line then set a static width so the text wraps…[/quote]

Today I was gettign annoyed because I couldnt finish anything because customers continuously walking theough the door so with out even thinking I did what I could.

I really appreciate everyone commenting and telling me what sucks and what doesnt. It helps a lot more then you guys know.

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts and comments?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Or at least center the white text in the tops of them

Bad idea:

yhiNvuA.png1774×716

Why is each line of the headers in a separate

tag? I’d love to see a text reader read them semantics. If you want them to be a separate line then set a static width so the text wraps…

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts and comments?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:14, topic:507711”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=625947.msg4259877#msg4259877 date=1363367226]
I don’t like how the layout is…
The top row of stuff has 4 items, and they’re smaller. Then the second row has 2 items, and they’re twice as big.
[/quote]
Right now my mind is going crazy trying to figure out how I went to display things so until I can figure that out or someone maybe throws me in the right direction it’s gonna look crappy :p[/quote]
Right now it’s a lot better
But you should have it like this:
[image][main text]
[content]
In those 4 boxes.

Or at least center the white text in the tops of them

Edit:
You should also look into changing the color of those strokes in the logo… It’s funky looking having those being blue, when the site theme is more grey/black and white.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

SilentCJ:

Unless you’re gonna restyle the copied and pasted weather widget to match the design of the rest of the site, just remove it, it’s tacky and unnecessary.

Yea today I was going to do that, check it again in a few minutes and let me know if it looks too empty in one spot. Thats really the only reason I put it there.

removed

item.title: Thoughts and comments?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:507711”]Well. From what I see. Everything is just thrown on there.
I mean, first you have stuff about traveling (the railroad and plane stuff), then it goes into hobbys and tuxedos (paint brush and groom/bride).
Then you’ve got the something about sports jackets (lettermans), dresses, and the weather report. Then at the end the news for prom.
It looks like everything was thrown on there at once. Oh and change your favicon.[/quote]
Yeah what the hell does this company even do? From a design standpoint it’s nice but wat

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts and comments?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

No problem. As the site progresses, I’ll continue to give you more feedback.

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts and comments?
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:4, topic:507711”]I’ve never been a fan of big pictures in slideshows. Do it proportionally, but size the picture down by a scale of, say, 20%.
The top rectangle, where the Contact Us and company name is located, I feel could be a bit smaller.
The Weather Report widget seems sort of useless in my opinion, unless you are running a local news site.
The “Who are you representing” and “Do you remember…?” boxes could be moved to a separate page listing regular products, with your promotional products being those that are on sale, new releases, etc.
More emphasis should be put on the News column, as this should be one of the very first things a site visitor should see.[/quote]

wow, thanks!
Ill move things around and see what I can come up with. Thanks again for the feedback.

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts and comments?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

I’ve never been a fan of big pictures in slideshows. Do it proportionally, but size the picture down by a scale of, say, 20%.
The top rectangle, where the Contact Us and company name is located, I feel could be a bit smaller.
The Weather Report widget seems sort of useless in my opinion, unless you are running a local news site.
The “Who are you representing” and “Do you remember…?” boxes could be moved to a separate page listing regular products, with your promotional products being those that are on sale, new releases, etc.
More emphasis should be put on the News column, as this should be one of the very first things a site visitor should see.

Read full topic

Either way, this looks nice so far. A little cluttered so far in my opinion, but nice nonetheless.[/quote]
lol Im the only “developer” and its a local company soooo xD

Thanks for the quick comment. Do you have any ideas of how I could make it not so cluttered?
